alert.note: Alert for Cedar (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 10:34AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Cedar and Polk. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1034 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dry Fork, South Fork Brush Creek, Turkey Creek, Bear Creek, Campbell Branch, Flint Creek, Green Spring Branch, Price Branch, Sac River, Spring Creek, Crabtree Branch, Barren Creek, Brush Creek, South Fork Turkey Creek, Sadler Branch, Abels Branch and West Fork Dry Fork. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Humansville, Fair Play, Dunnegan and Bearcreek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
